ds.util
Class Greater<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.Greater<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparator<T>
public class Greater<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Comparator<T>

A Comparator that imposes a total ordering on objects that implement Comparable; the comparison is the ">" relation where the ordering of elements proceeds from larger to smaller. An instance can be passed to the Arrays.sort method to order the array in descending order. An instance passed to the Heaps.heapsort method orders the array in ascending order. The HeapPQueue class uses a Greater comparator to create by default a maximum heap.

Constructor Detail

Greater

Method Detail

compare

public int compare(T x,
                   T y)
Compares its two arguments by using the opposite of the compareTo ordering for the argument type. The return value for compare is a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer indicating that the first argument is greater than, equal to, or less than the second argument. Throws a ClassCastException if the arguments are not comparable.

Specified by:
compare in interface Comparator<T>
Parameters:
x - the first object to be compared.
y - the second object to be compared.
Returns:
a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer indicating that the first argument is greater than, equal to, or less than the second argument.
Throws:
ClassCastException - if the arguments are not comparable.
